coding_practice.title: Positions of Large Groups
coding_practice.description:
In a string s of lowercase letters, these letters form consecutive groups of the same character.

For example, a string like s = "abbxxxxzyy" has the groups "a", "bb", "xxxx", "z", and "yy".

A group is identified by an interval [start, end], where start and end denote the start and end indices (inclusive) of the group.

A group is considered large if it has 3 or more characters.

Return the intervals of every large group sorted in increasing order by start index.

examples.explanation: "xxxx" is the only large group with start index 3 and end index 6.
We have groups "a", "b", and "c", none of which are large groups.

coding_practice.constraints:
1 <= s.length <= 1000
s contains lowercase English letters only.
coding_practice.explanation:
1. 使用指針 i 遍歷字符串，找到每個連續字符組的起始索引 start。
2. 當遇到不同字符時，檢查該組的長度是否 >= 3，如果是，將 [start, i] 添加到結果列表中。
3. 返回所有大組的索引列表。
